title: Tashkent
summary: Tashkent (/tæʃˈkɛnt/, US also /tɑːʃ-/) (from Russian: Ташкент), or Toshkent (/tɒʃˈkɛnt/; Uzbek: Toshkent/Тошкент/تاشکند‎, IPA: [tɒʃˈkent]), also historically known as Chāch (Persian: چاچ‎), is the capital and largest city of Uzbekistan, as well as the most populous city in Central Asia, with a population in 2018 of 2,485,900.[3] It is in northeastern Uzbekistan, near the border with Kazakhstan.
